markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Group Impression](/Feats.aspx?ID=789) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 262 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6)

</column>

---

When you Make an Impression, you can compare your Diplomacy check result to the Will DCs of two targets instead of one. It’s possible to get a different degree of success for each target. The number of targets increases to four if you’re an expert, 10 if you’re a master, and 25 if you’re legendary.
name: Group Impression

<traits>

</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Make an Impression on multiple targets at once.
</summary>
summary: Make an Impression on multiple targets at once.
summary_markdown: Make an Impression on multiple targets at once.
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 1" pfs="Standard" > Group Impression Source Core Rulebook pg. 262 4.0 Prerequisites Trained in Diplomacy --- When you Make an Impression, you can compare your Diplomacy check result to the Will DCs of two targets instead of one. It’s possible to get a different degree of success for each target. The number of targets increases to four if you’re an expert, 10 if you’re a master, and 25 if you’re legendary.
